intro: Stenochlaena haenkeana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed arrowroot, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces a spadix inflorescence typical of the arum family. The plant is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It has a rhizomatous root system that is used for propagation and is valued for its starchy tubers. The botanical features of S. haenkeana make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
